capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: The role requires advanced problem-solving skills to translate complex climate change data into practical insights for decision-making.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Must communicate complex scientific information clearly to a variety of stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Responsible for leading data delivery and insight development for climate change adaptation strategies.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Requires effective planning, coordination, and control methods to manage data-driven projects.

capabilities.name: Technology
capabilities.description: High proficiency in GIS, Python, Power BI, and AI for processing and translating large datasets.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role involves working across disciplines and with various stakeholders to develop data-driven solutions.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: The department values diversity and seeks to understand and serve the diverse communities of NSW.

skills.name: GIS and Data Analysis
skills.description: Using geographic information systems and data analysis tools to process and interpret environmental data.

skills.name: Python Programming
skills.description: Applying Python programming for data analysis and model development in climate science.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Engaging with internal and external partners to support climate change adaptation strategies.

skills.name: MERI Strategy Development
skills.description: Developing and implementing Monitoring, Evaluation, Reporting, and Improvement strategies.

generalRole.title: Senior Scientist in Climate Change Adaptation
generalRole.description: This role focuses on providing advanced technical, scientific, and analytical support for climate change-related programs, specifically in data leadership and insight development for adaptation strategies.
